course_title: Special Topics: Coaching Problem Solving Team
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 66 / Seats Avail: 35Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
The Coaching a Problem-Solving Team course is a three-credit, graduate-level course which develops your skills as a leader and project coach by coaching one or more IMPACT360 full-time MBA teams through their problem-solving process to ensure learning objectives are achieved and high-impact work is delivered to the client. As part of the course, participants serve as IMPACT Coaching Fellows (ICFs) assigned to one or more IMPACT360 project teams in the two-year, full-time MBA program. The fundamental purpose of this course is to assist students in the development of essential leadership and problem-solving coaching skills to accelerate their careers.
As part of the course, each ICF receives access to an executive coach and credit towards the Advanced Leadership Certificate.
The course focuses on three craft skill areas of leadership and problem solving to nurture a problem-solving team to deliver high quality, high impact results:
-	Performing effective coaching and communication
-	Building trust through credibility, reliability and intimacy in relationships while keeping self-orientation in check
-	Applying principles and processes of structured problem solving in a coaching context
course_description: This course is designed to offer a number of the new course topic.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the One-Year or Two-Year MBA program.
